meanings.definition: To begin or set out on a journey or course.
meanings.sent1: I startsy my homework as soon as I get home.
meanings.sent2: She startsy her day with a healthy breakfast.
meanings.sent3: The cat startsy chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The sun startsy its journey across the sky every morning.
meanings.sent5: The little seed startsy growing into a big tree.

meanings.definition: To cause to begin an action or movement.
meanings.sent1: He startsy the car by turning the key.
meanings.sent2: They startsy the party with a fun game.
meanings.sent3: The teacher startsy the class by clapping her hands.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock startsy the day with its loud ringing.
meanings.sent5: The conductor startsy the orchestra with a wave of the baton.

meanings.sent1: The squirrel made a startsy up the tree when it heard a noise.
meanings.sent2: Her startsy startled the other students in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The startsy of the balloon popping made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The startsy of the thunder made the dog hide under the bed.
meanings.sent5: The sudden startsy of the car screeching to a halt surprised everyone.
